cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 170C.
Beat the eggs in a large bowl until combined. Add the flour and beat until smooth, then add zucchini, onion, bacon, cheese and oil and stir to combine.
Grease and line a 30 x 20cm lamington pan. Pour into the prepared pan and bake in oven for 30 minutes or until cooked through

ingredients: 1 baby cos lettuce, leaves separated, torn
cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a large baking tray with baking paper. Place bread, in a single layer, on tray. Spray with oil. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes, turning halfway, or until golden and crisp.
Make Caesar dressing Combine yoghurt, mayonnaise, mustard and 2 teaspoons warm water in a small bowl. Season.
Heat a non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add bacon. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes or until crisp. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel.
Place lettuce in a large bowl. Add croutons, bacon, chicken and parmesan. Toss to combine. Transfer to plates. Top with egg. Serve drizzled with dressing.
Preheat oven to 220C. Place spinach in a bowl, pour over boiling water and stand for 1 minute or until spinach has wilted. Drain, then refresh under cold water. Squeeze dry and chop finely.
Place chicken in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper. Add garlic, rosemary and 2 tablespoons oil, and combine.
Heat a 26cm ovenproof or regular frying pan over high heat. Cook chicken, in 2 batches, for 1 minute each side or until browned. Transfer to a bowl and reserve pan if using an ovenproof one.

If using an ovenproof pan, place over medium heat and cook for 3 minutes, then transfer to oven and bake on the lowest shelf for 20 minutes or until pastry is golden and the filling has set. If using a cake pan, bake for 20 minutes on a heavy-based oven tray. Serve straight from the pan.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until browned.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, parmesan cheese, garlic, and black pepper.
Once the spaghetti is cooked, drain it and add it to the frying pan with the pancetta. Toss to combine.
Remove the frying pan from the heat and add the egg mixture. Toss the spaghetti to coat the noodles in the sauce. Serve immediately.

recipeName: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Herbs
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a small bowl, mix together the lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, parsley, dill, salt, and black pepper.
Place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and pour the lemon and herb mixture over them, making sure to coat them evenly.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with your choice of sides.

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into strips
cookingMethod: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken strips and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the heavy cream, parmesan cheese, butter, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened.
Add the cooked fettuccine pasta to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce. Serve hot.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Divide the ground beef into 4 equal portions and shape them into patties. Season the patties with salt and pepper.
Grill the patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until they are cooked to your desired doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheese on top of each patty to melt.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill for 1-2 minutes.
Assemble the burgers with the cooked patties, lettuce, tomato, and chopped onion. Spread ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise on the buns. Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 lb. Brussel sprouts, trimmed and halved
Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a large mixing bowl, toss the Brussel sprouts with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Add the diced bacon to the mixing bowl and mix well.
Spread the mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the Brussel sprouts are tender and the bacon is crispy.
Serve hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breasts with olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Grill the chicken breasts for 6-7 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through.
In a separate mixing bowl, combine the diced mango, chopped red onion, diced red bell pepper, chopped cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Spoon the mango salsa over the grilled chicken breasts.
Serve hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Cook the fusilli pasta according to package instructions.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the basil pesto, mayonnaise, grated parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Add the cooked pasta, diced sun-dried tomatoes, and chopped fresh basil to the mixing bowl. Toss to coat the pasta evenly with the pesto dressing.
Serve cold.

ingredients: 1 lb. beef sirloin, sliced into thin strips
Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced beef to the skillet and cook until browned. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
Add the chopped onion to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 1 minute.
Stir in the tomato paste and flour, and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Gradually stir in the beef broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Return the beef to the skillet and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the beef is cooked through.
Stir in the sour cream and heat through.
Serve hot over cooked egg noodles.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce, chopped cucumber, chopped tomato, crumbled feta cheese, sliced red onion, and kalamata olives.
In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Serve cold.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz.) black beans, drained and rinsed
cookingMethod: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned. Drain the excess fat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Transfer the beef mixture to a slow cooker.
Add the crushed tomatoes, kidney beans, black beans, tomato sauce, chili powder, ground cumin, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to the slow cooker. Stir to combine.
Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Serve hot with your choice of toppings, such as shredded cheese, sour cream, or diced avocado.

recipeName: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Dill
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and season with salt and black pepper.
Drizzle the olive oil over the salmon fillets and sprinkle with chopped fresh dill.
Place the sliced lemon on top of the salmon fillets.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.
Serve hot.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the chopped carrots and chopped bell pepper to the skillet and sauté for another 3-4 minutes.
Add the frozen peas to the skillet and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the lightly beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through.
Combine the vegetables and eggs in the skillet and add the cooked white rice.
Drizzle the soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice mixture and toss to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 lb. beef sirloin, sliced into thin strips
Salt and black pepper to taste
1 lb. egg noodles, cooked according to package instructions
cookingMethod: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced beef to the skillet and season with salt and black pepper. Cook for 3-4 minutes, or until browned on all sides. Transfer the beef to a plate.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and lightly browned.
Add the tomato paste to the skillet and stir to combine.
Pour the beef broth into the skillet and stir to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
Return the beef to the skillet and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the sour cream and butter.
Serve hot over cooked egg noodles.

ingredients: 1 lb. spaghetti, cooked according to package instructions
cookingMethod: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned. Drain the excess fat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine.
Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 20-30 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Serve hot over cooked spaghetti.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz.) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz.) pinto beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
cookingMethod: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the chopped green and red bell peppers to the pot and sauté for another 3-4 minutes.
Add the chili powder, ground cumin, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Pour in the diced tomatoes (with their juices), drained and rinsed kidney beans, black beans, and pinto beans. Stir to combine.
Pour in the vegetable broth and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the chili has thickened slightly.
Serve hot.
